data.name: Hellfire 1988: An Oregon Story
data.detailed_description:
What to Expect


Hellfire 1988: An Oregon Story is a story-rich visual novel set in Bend, Oregon during the Halloween of 1988. Hellfire 1988 is a darkly comic crime story with engaging interactive dialogue, point-and-click exploration, and exciting mini-games that combine to give players an immersive experience of 1980s America. Featuring a 30,000 word interactive script, hundreds of realistic story choices, trenchant dark humor, challenging puzzles, and a thrilling hard rock soundtrack, Hellfire 1988 is one of the first indie games to be made with Unreal Engine 5 and has an expected play time of about 2 to 4 hours. Available in English and Spanish.

A Glimpse Into the Past From the Future


Jennifer Craft is a seventeen-year-old slacker and metalhead living in the conservative logging town of Bend, Oregon. When a shocking crime confirms the townsfolk's worst suspicions about Jennifer, she must race against time to clear her name and save her loved ones.

100% of Sales to Bend, Oregon Community Assistance

100% of net proceeds (i.e. all money received from Steam payout) from Hellfire 1988 will be donated to the Bend Fire Community Assistance Program! The Bend Fire Community Assistance Program is a 501(c)(3) charitable organization run entirely by members of the Bend Oregon Fire Department:

"Often while firefighters are responding to emergencies, additional needs are noticed in conjunction with the emergency the person called for. These may be in the form of financial hardship and the inability to pay a bill, fill a car with fuel, clothe a child, or provide groceries for their family. The Community Assistance Program seeks to bridge these gaps with funds that are raised through donations by the community. As firefighters, we believe we have a special and unique opportunity to intervene in someone’s life during their most difficult time to help lessen the burden of financial stress. We are so grateful for the ability to help our community out in this way."

New with Version 1.0.2:

  • Added all new SPANISH translation provided by David "Gilded Z" Vasquez!
  • Added music volume slider on main menu
  • Added the actual verse in the hacking puzzle
  • Performance improvements

New with Version 1.0.1:

  • Added option to play just as Visual Novel without puzzles and point-and-click levels
  • Keep cursor visible throughout dialogues for easier access to save menu
  • Graphical performance optimizations
  • Fixed bug where game sometimes wouldn’t recall last choice point if Jennifer goes to jail
  • Removed graphic debug messages that pop up on some systems during point-and-click levels
  • Fixed typo in dialogue
  • Improved in-game menu visibility and added version indicator

data.short_description: Hellfire 1988: An Oregon Story is a story-rich visual novel with point-and-click adventure game elements. Featuring a 30,000 word interactive script, hundreds of story choices, challenging puzzles, and a thrilling hard rock soundtrack, Hellfire 1988 is a compelling dramatic adventure.
data.supported_languages: English, Spanish - Latin America, Spanish - Spain

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 7 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core 2, AMD Ryzen, or higher
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Recent NVidia GeForce or ATI Radeon graphics
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 15 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: The game may be played as a visual novel without the point-and-click sections to reduce graphics requirements.

content_descriptors.notes:
THIS GAME IS NOT FOR YOUNG KIDS!
This game includes mature dialogue about potentially upsetting topics including drug and alcohol use, crime, poverty, infidelity, prejudice, and Satanism. Foul language is frequently encountered and there is mild sexual inneundo.
